content.text: table with data related to estimated and actual meter readings and account counts for a specified billing period. It processes data from the

tables, categorizing them by utility company and energy type. The procedure also calculates differences between estimated and billed readings to derive actual readings and prepares data for dashboard visualization.
The procedure involves multiple SQL operations, including

. It processes data in several steps, each targeting different aspects of the billing data (meters and accounts) and includes calculations for actual readings. The complexity arises from the multiple layers of data aggregation and the need to handle different categories of data (utility company, energy type).
: This parameter specifies the billing period for which the data is being processed. It is used to filter records in the source tables and to tag the inserted records in the target table.

: This parameter is used to filter data based on the agency associated with the provided email address. It ensures that only data relevant to the active agencies linked to the email address is processed.
: The procedure first inserts estimated meter counts into the target table, categorized by utility company and energy type. It filters records where
: It then inserts billed meter counts, again categorized by utility company and energy type, without filtering on
: The procedure calculates actual meter counts by subtracting estimated counts from billed counts for each category and inserts the results into the target table.
: The procedure processes account-level data similarly, inserting actual and billed counts categorized by utility company and energy type.
: It prepares data for dashboard visualization, inserting actual and billed account counts with additional agency information.
: Finally, it calculates estimated account counts for the dashboard by subtracting actual counts from billed counts.
: Ensure that the tables involved, especially those with large datasets, have appropriate indexes on columns used in
: If the dataset is large, consider processing data in batches to avoid locking issues and reduce transaction log growth.
: The procedure lock resources for extended periods, impacting other operations. Consider using transaction isolation levels or row versioning to mitigate this.
: The procedure assumes that the data in the source tables is accurate and complete. Any discrepancies in the source data could lead to incorrect counts being inserted.
: The procedure performs multiple insert operations, which could lead to locking issues if the target table is accessed concurrently by other processes.
: The procedure lacks explicit error handling. Consider adding try-catch blocks to handle exceptions and ensure that the procedure fails gracefully.
: As the volume of data grows, the performance of the procedure may degrade. Regular monitoring and optimization may be necessary to maintain performance.
: Ensure that the procedure is executed with appropriate permissions to prevent unauthorized data access or modification.

CREATE PROCEDURE [Billing].[usp_Load_EstimatedActualCounts]
(
    @PublishedBillingPeriod AS BillingPeriod,
    @EmailAddress AS emailaddr
)
AS 
BEGIN
	SET NOCOUNT ON;

	-- Estimated
	INSERT INTO Billing.EstimatedActualReadingCounts (BillingPeriod, DataType, Reading, Header, DataCount)
	-- Meter level counts by utility company ESTIMATED
	SELECT @PublishedBillingPeriod, 'Meters' AS DataType, 'Estimated' AS Reading
		,CASE WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 2 THEN 'National Grid West Meters' WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 7 THEN 'NYPA Meters' WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 9 THEN 'Coned Meters' ELSE 'Meters from Other' END AS Header
		,COUNT(*) AS mcount
	FROM Published.TemporalAccountMeterLevelRawDataForCurrentPeriod AS TA
		INNER JOIN dbo.uftn_TableGetActiveAgenciesByEmailAddress(@EmailAddress) AS A ON TA.AgencyCodeOEC = A.AgencyCodeOEC
	WHERE TA.EffectiveStartPeriod <= @PublishedBillingPeriod AND TA.EffectiveEndPeriod > @PublishedBillingPeriod
		AND TA.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod AND TA.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading > 0
	GROUP BY TA.UtilityCompanySeqid
	UNION
	-- Meter level counts by EnergyType ESTIMATED
	SELECT @PublishedBillingPeriod, 'Meters' AS DataType, 'Estimated' AS Reading
		,CASE WHEN TA.EnergyDeliveryType = 1 THEN 'ELE Meters' WHEN TA.EnergyDeliveryType = 5 THEN 'GAS Meters' WHEN TA.EnergyDeliveryType = 6 THEN 'Steam Meters' ELSE 'Meters from Other Types' END AS Header
		,COUNT(*) AS mcount
	FROM Published.TemporalAccountMeterLevelRawDataForCurrentPeriod AS TA
		INNER JOIN dbo.uftn_TableGetActiveAgenciesByEmailAddress(@EmailAddress) AS A ON TA.AgencyCodeOEC = A.AgencyCodeOEC
	WHERE TA.EffectiveStartPeriod <= @PublishedBillingPeriod AND TA.EffectiveEndPeriod > @PublishedBillingPeriod
		AND TA.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod AND TA.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading > 0
	GROUP BY TA.EnergyDeliveryType
	UNION
	-- Billed
	-- Meter level counts by utility company Billed
	SELECT @PublishedBillingPeriod , 'Meters' AS DataType, 'Billed' AS Reading
		,CASE WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 2 THEN 'National Grid West Meters' WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 7 THEN 'NYPA Meters' WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 9 THEN 'Coned Meters' ELSE 'Meters from Other' END Header
		,COUNT(*) mcount
	FROM Published.TemporalAccountMeterLevelRawDataForCurrentPeriod AS TA
		INNER JOIN dbo.uftn_TableGetActiveAgenciesByEmailAddress(@EmailAddress) AS A ON TA.AgencyCodeOEC = A.AgencyCodeOEC
	WHERE TA.EffectiveStartPeriod <= @PublishedBillingPeriod AND TA.EffectiveEndPeriod > @PublishedBillingPeriod
		AND TA.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod
	GROUP BY TA.UtilityCompanySeqid
	UNION
	-- Meter level counts by EnergyType Billed
	SELECT @PublishedBillingPeriod, 'Meters' AS DataType, 'Billed' AS Reading
		,CASE WHEN TA.EnergyDeliveryType = 1 THEN 'ELE Meters' WHEN TA.EnergyDeliveryType = 5 THEN 'GAS Meters' WHEN TA.EnergyDeliveryType = 6 THEN 'Steam Meters' ELSE 'Meters from Other Types' END AS Header
		,COUNT(*) AS mcount
	FROM Published.TemporalAccountMeterLevelRawDataForCurrentPeriod AS TA
		INNER JOIN dbo.uftn_TableGetActiveAgenciesByEmailAddress(@EmailAddress) AS A ON TA.AgencyCodeOEC = A.AgencyCodeOEC
	WHERE TA.EffectiveStartPeriod <= @PublishedBillingPeriod AND TA.EffectiveEndPeriod > @PublishedBillingPeriod
		AND TA.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod --AND TA.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading > 0
	GROUP BY TA.EnergyDeliveryType;

	-------------
	-- Actual calculated inser for meters
	INSERT INTO Billing.EstimatedActualReadingCounts (BillingPeriod, DataType, Reading, Header, DataCount)
	SELECT b.BillingPeriod, b.DataType, 'Actual' AS Reading, b.Header, (b.DataCount - e.DataCount)
	FROM (SELECT * FROM Billing.EstimatedActualReadingCounts AS e
			WHERE e.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod AND e.Reading = 'Estimated' AND e.DataType = 'Meters') AS e
		INNER JOIN (SELECT * FROM Billing.EstimatedActualReadingCounts AS e
			WHERE e.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod AND e.Reading = 'Billed' AND e.DataType = 'Meters') AS b
				ON b.BillingPeriod = e.BillingPeriod AND b.DataType = e.DataType AND b.Header = e.Header;

	-----------------------------------------------
	INSERT INTO Billing.EstimatedActualReadingCounts (BillingPeriod, DataType, Reading, Header, DataCount)
	-- Account level counts by utility company ACTUAL
	SELECT @PublishedBillingPeriod , 'Accounts' AS DataType, 'Actual' AS Reading, acctLvl.Header, COUNT(*) AS acount
	FROM (SELECT CASE WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 2 THEN 'National Grid West Accounts' WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 7 THEN 'NYPA Accounts' WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 9 THEN 'Coned Accounts' ELSE 'Accounts from Other' END AS Header
			,TA.UniqueAccountSeqID, MAX(TA.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading) er
		FROM Published.AccountMeterLevelRawDataForCurrentPeriod AS TA 
			INNER JOIN dbo.uftn_TableGetActiveAgenciesByEmailAddress(@EmailAddress) AS A ON TA.AgencyCodeOEC = A.AgencyCodeOEC
		WHERE TA.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod 
		GROUP BY TA.UtilityCompanySeqid, TA.UniqueAccountSeqID
		HAVING MAX(TA.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading) = 0) AS acctLvl
	GROUP BY acctLvl.Header
	UNION
	-- Account level counts by utility company Billed
	SELECT @PublishedBillingPeriod , 'Accounts' AS DataType, 'Billed' AS Reading, acctLvl.Header, COUNT(*) AS acount
	FROM (SELECT CASE WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 2 THEN 'National Grid West Accounts' WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 7 THEN 'NYPA Accounts' WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 9 THEN 'Coned Accounts' ELSE 'Accounts from Other' END AS Header
			,TA.UniqueAccountSeqID, MAX(TA.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading) AS er
		FROM Published.AccountMeterLevelRawDataForCurrentPeriod AS TA 
			INNER JOIN dbo.uftn_TableGetActiveAgenciesByEmailAddress(@EmailAddress) AS A ON TA.AgencyCodeOEC = A.AgencyCodeOEC
		WHERE TA.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod 
		GROUP BY TA.UtilityCompanySeqid, TA.UniqueAccountSeqID) AS acctLvl
	GROUP BY acctLvl.Header
	UNION
	-- Account level counts by Energy Type ACTUAL
	SELECT @PublishedBillingPeriod , 'Accounts' AS DataType, 'Actual' AS Reading, acctLvl.Header, COUNT(*) AS acount
	FROM (SELECT CASE WHEN TA.EnergyDeliveryType = 1 THEN 'ELE Accounts' WHEN TA.EnergyDeliveryType = 5 THEN 'GAS Accounts' WHEN TA.EnergyDeliveryType = 6 THEN 'Steam Accounts' ELSE 'Accounts from Other Types' END AS Header
			,TA.UniqueAccountSeqID,MAX(TA.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading) er
		FROM Published.AccountMeterLevelRawDataForCurrentPeriod AS TA 
			INNER JOIN dbo.uftn_TableGetActiveAgenciesByEmailAddress(@EmailAddress) AS A ON TA.AgencyCodeOEC = A.AgencyCodeOEC
		WHERE TA.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod 
		GROUP BY TA.EnergyDeliveryType, TA.UniqueAccountSeqID
		HAVING MAX(TA.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading) = 0) AS acctLvl
	GROUP BY acctLvl.Header
	UNION
	-- Account level counts by Energy Type Billed
	SELECT @PublishedBillingPeriod , 'Accounts' AS DataType, 'Billed' AS Reading, acctLvl.Header, COUNT(*) AS acount
	FROM (SELECT CASE WHEN TA.EnergyDeliveryType = 1 THEN 'ELE Accounts' WHEN TA.EnergyDeliveryType = 5 THEN 'GAS Accounts' WHEN TA.EnergyDeliveryType = 6 THEN 'Steam Accounts' ELSE 'Accounts from Other Types' END AS Header
			,TA.UniqueAccountSeqID,MAX(TA.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading) er
		FROM Published.AccountMeterLevelRawDataForCurrentPeriod AS TA 
			INNER JOIN dbo.uftn_TableGetActiveAgenciesByEmailAddress(@EmailAddress) AS A ON TA.AgencyCodeOEC = A.AgencyCodeOEC
		WHERE TA.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod 
		GROUP BY TA.EnergyDeliveryType, TA.UniqueAccountSeqID) AS acctLvl
	GROUP BY acctLvl.Header;

	-- Estimated calculated inser for Accounts
	INSERT INTO Billing.EstimatedActualReadingCounts (BillingPeriod, DataType, Reading, Header, DataCount)
	SELECT b.BillingPeriod, b.DataType, 'Estimated' AS Reading, b.Header, (b.DataCount - e.DataCount)
	FROM (SELECT * FROM Billing.EstimatedActualReadingCounts AS e
		WHERE e.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod AND e.Reading = 'Actual' AND e.DataType = 'Accounts') AS e
		INNER JOIN (SELECT * FROM Billing.EstimatedActualReadingCounts AS e
		WHERE e.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod AND e.Reading = 'Billed' AND e.DataType = 'Accounts') AS b
			ON b.BillingPeriod = e.BillingPeriod AND b.DataType = e.DataType AND b.Header = e.Header;
	-----------------------------------------------

	-- dashboard chart data 
	INSERT INTO Billing.EstimatedActualReadingCounts (BillingPeriod, DataType, Reading, Header, DataCount, Agency)
	-- Account level counts by utility company ACTUAL
	SELECT @PublishedBillingPeriod , 'Dashboard' AS DataType, 'Actual' AS Reading, acctLvl.Header, COUNT(*) AS acount, acctLvl.AgencyCodeOEC
	FROM (SELECT CASE WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 7 THEN 'NYPA' WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 2 THEN 'NGrid West' WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 9 AND TA.EnergyType = 'GAS' THEN 'Con Edison GAS' ELSE 'Other' END AS Header
			,TA.UniqueAccountSeqID, MAX(TA.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading) AS er, TA.AgencyCodeOEC
		FROM Published.AccountMeterLevelRawDataForCurrentPeriod AS TA 
			INNER JOIN dbo.uftn_TableGetActiveAgenciesByEmailAddress(@EmailAddress) AS A ON TA.AgencyCodeOEC = A.AgencyCodeOEC
		WHERE TA.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod 
		GROUP BY TA.UtilityCompanySeqid, TA.UniqueAccountSeqID, TA.EnergyType, TA.AgencyCodeOEC
		HAVING MAX(TA.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading) = 0) AS acctLvl
	GROUP BY acctLvl.Header, acctLvl.AgencyCodeOEC
	UNION
	-- Account level counts by utility company Billed
	SELECT @PublishedBillingPeriod , 'Dashboard' AS DataType, 'Billed' AS Reading, acctLvl.Header, COUNT(*) AS acount, acctLvl.AgencyCodeOEC
	FROM (SELECT CASE WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 7 THEN 'NYPA' WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 2 THEN 'NGrid West' WHEN TA.UtilityCompanySeqid = 9 AND TA.EnergyType = 'GAS' THEN 'Con Edison GAS' ELSE 'Other' END AS Header
			,TA.UniqueAccountSeqID, MAX(TA.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading) AS er, TA.AgencyCodeOEC
		FROM Published.AccountMeterLevelRawDataForCurrentPeriod AS TA 
			INNER JOIN dbo.uftn_TableGetActiveAgenciesByEmailAddress(@EmailAddress) AS A ON TA.AgencyCodeOEC = A.AgencyCodeOEC
		WHERE TA.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod 
		GROUP BY TA.UtilityCompanySeqid, TA.UniqueAccountSeqID , TA.EnergyType, TA.AgencyCodeOEC) AS acctLvl
	GROUP BY acctLvl.Header, acctLvl.AgencyCodeOEC;

	-- Estimated calculated inser for Accounts
	INSERT INTO Billing.EstimatedActualReadingCounts (BillingPeriod, DataType, Reading, Header, DataCount, Agency)
	SELECT b.BillingPeriod, b.DataType, 'Estimated' AS Reading, b.Header, (b.DataCount - e.DataCount), b.Agency
	FROM (SELECT * FROM Billing.EstimatedActualReadingCounts AS e
			WHERE e.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod AND e.Reading = 'Actual' AND e.DataType = 'Dashboard') AS e
		INNER JOIN (SELECT * FROM Billing.EstimatedActualReadingCounts AS e
			WHERE e.BillingPeriod = @PublishedBillingPeriod AND e.Reading = 'Billed' AND e.DataType = 'Dashboard') AS b
			ON b.BillingPeriod = e.BillingPeriod AND b.DataType = e.DataType AND b.Header = e.Header AND b.Agency = e.Agency;
END;
